result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Cervantes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Cervantes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Daniel Cervantes.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hall has been recently appointed. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Cervantes appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in the trial court to track with 21CF4697.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CJS;
Kwik Trip at 6716 W. Lincoln Ave.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. Court ordered SCRAM bracelet to monitor the Defendant maintains absolute sobriety. No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Daniel Cervantes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Daniel Cervantes.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
